title: Piers Morgan reveals his drink was spiked with unknown drug in his twenties

Piers Morgan has revealed his drink was spiked while he was on a night out in his early twenties.

The Good Morning Britain host made the confession as he shared his disapproval of the latest Extinction Rebellion protests going on in central London.

Scenes from one area saw two people raving in the street as the protests continued, while Piers argued this wasn't exactly a means of demonstation.

Watching the video, his co-host Susanna Reid confessed: "I'd love to set up a rave in London," leading to the admission from the presenter.

(Image: ITV)

He revealed that, while he still doesn't know what he was drugged with, something was slipped into his drink.

The result was an eight-hour dancing session, while Susanna appeared slightly concerned.

He said: "I’m very happy for them all. The last time I danced like that was in my early twenties when somebody slipped something into my drink.

(Image: PA)

Piers continued: "They did. I never found out what it was but I danced like for about eight hours."

He then turned his attention back to the rebellion protests, admitting he was not on board with it.

Earlier on in the show, Susanna called out her co-host over an apparent blunder as he read words from the auto-cue he wasn't supposed to.

(Image: ITV)

Before informing viewers of the time, Piers said the words "time check" with Susanna claiming he wasn't supposed to.

Piers responded: "I read time check to annoy you. If you don't want me to say time check, don't put it in the auto-cue."

He then gave fans a glimpse of the auto-cue screen, revealing the script for the upcoming segment on the show.

Good Morning Britain airs weekdays at 6am on ITV.
description: Good Morning Britain host Piers Morgan had his drink spiked with an unknown drug when he was in his twenties
